pr_title: Display logs on the developer menu

timeline.bodyText: This seems like overkill. Instead, I'd recommend  doing away with the RetrieveLogs. Instead, in your DevMenu, hang on to the instance of the PersistentLogStoragePlugin, as an instance variable. Then, whenever you want the logs, just do plugin.getLogs(), directly.
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

+/**
+ * Retrieves and formats the logs to be displayed on the developer menu.
+ */
+public class RetrieveLogs {
+
+    /**
+     * Returns a String representation of all of the stored logs.
+     * @return the stored logs as a String.
+     */
+    public String getLogs() {
+        String persistentPluginKey = new PersistentLogStoragePlugin().getPluginKey();
+        LoggingPlugin<?> persistentLogPlugin = Amplify.Logging.getPlugin(persistentPluginKey);
+        List<LogEntry> logs = ((PersistentLogStoragePlugin) persistentLogPlugin).getLogs();

timeline.bodyText: This is probably not in scope for this PR, but it would be great if the log menu updated in real time, instead of just onCreateView.   Is that possible?
timeline.author: richardmcclellan

replies.bodyText: It might be possible using either Android's ObservableList to store the logs in each PersistentLogger or making PersistentLogger observable.
replies.author: eeatonaws
